intro: Bastardia hirsutiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered bastardia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. It is often found in coastal areas and dry slopes, where it adapts well to harsh conditions. Bastardia hirsutiflora is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
